Measure Name: HCAHPS Care Transition Measure (CTM) [Composite of questions 23 through 25]
Admit Decision Time to ED Departure Time for Admitted Patients
Patients discharged on multiple antipsychotic medications with appropriate justification
Cleanliness of hospital environment - star rating
Responsiveness of hospital staff  - star rating
Quietness of hospital environment  - star rating
Median time from ED arrival to ED departure for discharged ED patients
Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Discharged ED Patients – Psychiatric/Men
Fibrinolytic Therapy Received Within 30 Minutes of ED Arrival
Head CT scan results for acute ischemic stroke or hemorrhagic stroke who received head C
Median Time to transfer to another facility for acute coronary intervention
Postoperative pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis rate
Death among surgical patients with serious, treatable complications
Central Venous Catheter-Related Bloodstream Infections Rate
Willingness to recommend the hospital (global measure)
Alcohol Use Brief Intervention Provided or Offered
Alcohol and other Drug Use Disorder Treatment Provided or Offered at Discharge
Tobacco Use Treatment Provided or Offered
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) 30-day mortality rate
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) 30-day readmission rate
